Definition at line 56 of file N_Cmi.h.

Field Documentation

void(* N_Cmi_Callback_t::SyncLoss)(void)

The end-device has detected that it has lost its parent.

Definition at line 60 of file N_Cmi.h.

void(* N_Cmi_Callback_t::StartNetworking)(void)

Indicate that the device is going to join a (new) network.

This is called when N_Cmi_StartNetworking is called. The callback can be used by platform components to reset variables. Application components can use the callback from N_DeviceInfo to see if a network is joined. This ensures that the platform components get a notification before the application components.

Definition at line 70 of file N_Cmi.h.

void(* N_Cmi_Callback_t::NetworkKeyIndication)(uint8_t networkKeySequenceNumber)

The device has received a network key, for example after joining a network via association.

Parameters:
networkKeySequenceNumberThe sequence number of the received network key

Definition at line 75 of file N_Cmi.h.

void(* N_Cmi_Callback_t::NetworkAddressChanged)(uint16_t networkAddress)

The device has received a new network address (probably after an address conflict).

Parameters:
networkAddressThe new network address

Definition at line 80 of file N_Cmi.h.

int8_t N_Cmi_Callback_t::endOfList

The device has received a leave request or leave indication.

Parameters:
leaveIndicationThe leave request/indication Guard.
